reference.title: API Search / Select
reference.shortdesc: API Search/Select is the interface to query the OSS search engine. The call is sent through a HTTP request. POST OR GET are both available. The engine will answer with a XML result.

refbody.section: Url call Basic relative url is : /select

section.title: Parameters
section.note: Parameters have to be encoded in UTF-8.

strow.stentry: same as parameter q. Ex.: query=try
Enables you to pre-load a set query in index configuration file config.xml. Ex.: qt=requestName
Indicates the first result's rank shown. This parameter allows for a pagination. Ex.: start=10
Indicates the number of records to returned. Associated with the 'start' parameter, This parameter allows for a pagination. Ex.: rows=5
Indicates the language of the keywords passed to parameter q. The engine will use the matching analyzer. Ex.: lang=fr
Active collapsing on the field passed as a parameter. Ex.: collapse.field=hostname
Indicates the number of documents to send before collapsing activation. Ex.: collapse.max=2
If this parameter is passed, the documents returned by the query are removed. Ex.: &delete
Disables the cache (for the current call only). Ex.: &noCache
Enables the debug information in the result. Ex.: &debug
Adds a filter to the current call. The parameters can be used several times in the same call for successive filters. Ex.: fq=date:20101201&fq=color:red
Adds one or more fields to send. Ex.: &rf=date&rf=color
Controls results order. Using the abbreviation + ou - to sort by ascending or descending. Ex.: &sort=-date&sort=color
Enables faceting for the field passed as a parameter. You can add a number in parenthesis to specify the minimum count. Ex.: &facet=color ou &facet=color(2)
Same as parameter facet, to use with fields containing multiple values (multi-valued fields). Ex.: &facet.multi=color ou &facet.multi=color(2)

section.title: XML result
section.note: The answer is in XML format encoded in UTF-8.
